content.description: The mean length <math alttext="mu" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of male geckos is 9.5 inches. A researcher studying a population of geckos in a certain region will conduct a hypothesis test to investigate whether there is evidence that the mean length is greater than 9.5 inches. A random sample of geckos was selected, and the sample mean <math alttext="x bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> was calculated as 10 inches.
content.question: Which of the following is the correct set of hypotheses?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0: x bar equals 10. H sub a: x bar is not equal to 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>≠</mo><mn>10</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: x bar equals 10. H sub a: x bar is less than 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo><</mo><mn>10</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 9.5. H sub a: mu is greater than 9.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9.5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>></mo><mn>9.5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 9.5. H sub a: mu is less than 9.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9.5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>9.5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 9.5. H sub a: mu is not equal to 9.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9.5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>9.5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 9.5. H sub a: mu is greater than 9.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9.5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>></mo><mn>9.5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
